headline: Biden Edges Closer to a Presidential Run
summary: Former Vice President Joe Biden edged closer to a third presidential bid on Saturday, telling Democratic activists in his home state that the 2020 election would be the most important in a century.

headline: Trump Takes Aim at GM, Google in Saturday Tweets
summary: President Trump took a swipe at a pair of corporate giants as part of his continuing push to have U.S. companies boost their employment and production activities domestically.

headline: U.S. Places Sanctions on Russians Over Conflict in Ukraine
summary: The U.S. imposed sanctions on a number of Russian individuals and firms in response to a November attack off the coast of Crimea and the annexation of the Ukrainian peninsula five years ago.

headline: Police Say Suspect in Fatal Shooting of Reputed Mob Boss in Custody
summary: A suspect in the fatal shooting of the reputed boss of the Gambino crime family was taken into custody Saturday, according to New York City Police Department officials.

headline: Yellow-Vest Protests Persist in Paris Despite Macron Outreach
summary: Clashes erupted between police and demonstrators on the 18th-straight Saturday of yellow-vest protests in Paris.

headline: Trapped in New Zealand’s Mosque, Worshiper Attempted to Disarm Gunman
summary: Naeem Rashid, originally from Pakistan, tried to wrestle the gun from the assailant during a massacre at the Al Noor mosque in Christchurch. He was shot dead, but his act of heroism is among the tales to trickle out of the mosque that suffered the worst of the carnage.

headline: Smaller Hospitals Press for Chance to Offer Heart-Valve Procedure
summary: A heart-valve replacement procedure called TAVR has transformed treatment of certain heart-disease patients. But Medicare rules limit which hospitals can offer it, and some smaller facilities argue that patients lose out.

headline: Apple Watch Has Mixed Results in Big Heart Study
summary: Apple’s watch helped detect a heart-rhythm disorder in a small number of users in a large study but may have caused false alarms for others.

headline: Looking for Hope in the Rubble of Value Investing
summary: In October, WSJ columnist James Mackintosh was hopeful that a rotation out of highflying tech stocks into cheap laggards would help to support the market. He was wrong, he says.

headline: Ethiopia Mourns the Loss of Two Young Pilots
summary: When Ethiopian Airlines pilot Yared Getachew’s stops in Nairobi were brief, his mother would meet him at the airport for lunch before bidding him farewell again. Last Sunday, he didn’t make it.

headline: Mark Hamill Tries Knighthood Without the Lightsaber
summary: Famous for playing Luke Skywalker in ‘Star Wars,’ the actor talks about his unexpected career path and the dark side of being a Jedi knight.

headline: Can a Person Learn While Sleeping?
summary: A growing number of neuroscientists believe that sleep not only helps cement memories, but is actually a time to learn something new.

headline: Christchurch’s Tiny Community of Muslims: Diverse, Deeply Rooted and Embraced
summary: Survivors of the attacks that killed 50 people at two mosques in the New Zealand city of Christchurch said the Muslim community’s strength was in its diversity.

headline: As China Faces Slowdown, Stimulus Will Have Smaller Global Reach
summary: China’s spending spree during the global financial crisis helped pull the world economy out of recession. This time, Beijing’s stimulus might not pack the same punch.

headline: Bernie Sanders Campaigns in South Carolina With a Different Strategy
summary: Sen. Bernie Sanders returned this week to South Carolina, a state that spurned him in 2016, and tried again to connect with black voters—a crucial bloc in the state’s first-in-the-South Democratic primary.

headline: ‘Moroni: The Riches of Renaissance Portraiture’ Review: Luxurious Is the Watchword
summary: An exhibition at the Frick is filled with Giovanni Battista Moroni’s opulent portraits and many of the accouterments depicted therein.

headline: No Gym Can Match Her Hula Hoop
summary: To beat stress and stay fit, this Tennessee nurse practitioner swears by a pastiche of low-tech fitness routines.

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: New Zealand Shooter Was Active for More Than 30 Minutes, Timeline Shows
summary: An Australian man accused of New Zealand’s worst-ever mass shooting was active for more than half an hour, police said, offering their first official timeline of events that left 50 people dead at two mosques.

headline: PG&E Close to Naming New CEO, New Board
summary: PG&E Corp. is likely to name Bill Johnson, retiring head of the Tennessee Valley Authority, as its new chief executive and to announce a board overhaul backed by some of its large hedge-fund investors.

headline: Remember, It’s Their College Years, Not Yours
summary: The admissions scandal hitting schools is an extreme example, but during application season many parents could use a healthy reminder to ease up on their teen.
